1.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
1.str2: How much, how great, how many, as great as, as much. By reduplication from hos; as As.

1.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
1.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
From the root of zeugnumi; a coupling, i.e. servitude; also the beam of the balance.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.

1.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
1.str2: (a) To lead, (b) To think, be of opinion, suppose, consider.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A lord, master, or prince. Perhaps from deo and posis; an absolute ruler.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Worthy, worthy of, deserving, comparable, suitable. Probably from ago; deserving, comparable or suitable.
A price, honor. From tino; a value, i.e. Money paid, or valuables; by analogy, esteem, or the dignity itself.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

1.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
1.str2: From blasphemos; to vilify; specially, to speak impiously.

2.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

2.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
2.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
A lord, master, or prince. Perhaps from deo and posis; an absolute ruler.

2.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Plural
2.str2: To despise, scorn, and show it by active insult, disregard. From kata and phroneo; to think against, i.e. Disesteem.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

2.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
2.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

2.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Plural
2.str2: To be a slave, be subject to, obey, be devoted. From doulos; to be a slave to.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

2.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
2.str2: From anti and the middle voice of lambano; to take hold of in turn, i.e. Succor; also to participate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Good action, well-doing, benefiting, kind service. From euergetes; beneficence.

2.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
2.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From agapao; beloved.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.

2.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
2.str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.
And, even, also, namely.

2.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
2.str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
This; he, she, it.

3.str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

3.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
3.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

3.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
3.str2: From heteros and didaskalos; to instruct differently.

3.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
3.str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.

3.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
3.str2: From hugies; to have sound health, i.e. Be well; figuratively, to be uncorrupt.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.

3.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
3.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Piety (towards God), godliness, devotion, godliness. From eusebes; piety; specially, the gospel scheme.

4.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
4.str2: From a derivative of tupho; to envelop with smoke, i.e. to inflate with self-conceit.

4.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
4.str2: To know, know of, understand. Apparently a middle voice of ephistemi; to put the mind upon, i.e. Comprehend, or be acquainted with.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

4.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
4.str2: To be diseased, hence of mental or spiritual disease. From nosos; to be sick, i.e. to hanker after.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
A question, debate, controversy; a seeking, search. From zeteo; a searching, i.e. A dispute or its theme.
Contention about words, an unprofitable controversy. From the same as logomacheo; disputation about trifles.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

4.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Feminine Plural
Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
4.str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Envy, a grudge, spite. Probably akin to the base of phtheiro; ill-will, i.e. Jealousy.
Contention, strife, wrangling. Of uncertain affinity; a quarrel, i.e. wrangling.
Abusive or scurrilous language, blasphemy. From blasphemos; vilification.
A supposition, suspicion. From huponoeo; suspicion.

5.str2: Useless debate. From a compound of para and diatribo; misemployment, i.e. Meddlesomeness.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

5.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
5.str2: To destroy, waste; hence met: I corrupt. From diaballo and phtheiro; to rot thoroughly, i.e. to ruin.
Probably from the base of ginosko; the intellect, i.e. Mind; by implication, meaning.

5.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
5.str2: To defraud, deprive of, despoil; mid: I endure deprivation; pass: To be bereft of. From apo and stereo; to despoil.

5.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
5.str2: From nomos; properly, to do by law, i.e. To accustom; by extension, to deem or regard.
Piety (towards God), godliness, devotion, godliness. From eusebes; piety; specially, the gospel scheme.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A source of gain, livelihood. From a derivative of poros; furnishing, i.e. money-getting.

6.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Piety (towards God), godliness, devotion, godliness. From eusebes; piety; specially, the gospel scheme.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
Self-sufficiency, independence, contentment. From autarkes; self-satisfaction, i.e. contentedness, or a competence.

6.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
6.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
A source of gain, livelihood. From a derivative of poros; furnishing, i.e. money-getting.

7.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

7.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
7.str2: To lead into, bring in, announce. From eis and phero; to carry inward.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.

7.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
7.str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
To bring out, carry out, sometimes out of the city for burial; I bring forth, bear, produce. From ek and phero; to bear out.

7.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
7.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

8.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

8.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Nourishment, food. From a compound of dia and trepho; nourishment.
Clothing, a covering, raiment. From a derivative of skepas; clothing.

8.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
8.str2: To keep off, assist; I suffice; pass: To be satisfied. Apparently a primary verb; properly, to ward off, i.e. to avail.

9.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

9.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
9.str2: To will, intend, desire, wish. Middle voice of a primary verb; to 'will, ' i.e. be willing.

A primary particle; but, and, etc.

9.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural

A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From peirazo; a putting to proof (of good), experience (of evil), solicitation, discipline or provocation); by implication, adversity.
And, even, also, namely.
From pegnumi; a trap; figuratively, a trick or statagem.
Much, many; often.
Foolish, thoughtless. By implication, sensual.
And, even, also, namely.
Injurious, hurtful. From blapto; injurious.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.

9.str2: Whosoever, whichsoever, whatsoever.

Love of money, avarice, covetousness. From philarguros; avarice.

All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Bad, evil, in the widest sense. Apparently a primary word; worthless, i.e. depraved, or injurious.

Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

Pontius. Of Latin origin; apparently bridged; Pontius, a Roman.
Pilate. Of Latin origin; close-pressed, i.e. Firm; Pilatus, a Roman.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An ordinance, injunction, command, law. From entellomai; injunction, i.e. An authoritative prescription.
Irreproachable, never caught doing wrong. Not arrested, i.e. inculpable.

Appearing, manifestation, glorious display. From epiphanes; a manifestation, i.e. the advent of Christ.

Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

Only, solitary, desolate. Probably from meno; remaining, i.e. Sole or single; by implication, mere.

All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

17.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
17.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The faculty or experience of enjoyment. From a comparative of apo and lauo; full enjoyment.

18.str2: To work that which is good, perform good deeds. From agathos and ergon; to work good.
To become rich, be rich, abound in. From ploutizo; to be wealthy.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From eu and a presumed derivative of metadidomi; good at imparting, i.e. Liberal.
Willing to share, sociable, ready to communicate, beneficent. From koinonos; communicative, i.e. liberal.

19.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
19.str2: To store up, treasure up. From apo and thesaurizo; to treasure away.

19.parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural

19.str2: Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
From a derivative of tithemi; something put down, i.e. A substruction.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

19.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Singular
19.str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

19.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Plural
19.str2: To lay hold of, take hold of, seize (sometimes with beneficent, sometimes with hostile, intent).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Really, truly, actually. Adverb of the oblique cases of on; really.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.

20.str2: A primary interjection; as a sign of the vocative case, O; as a note of exclamation, oh.
Timothy, a Christian of Lystra, helper of Paul. From time and theos; dear to God; Timotheus, a Christian.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
20.str2: Probably from phule through the idea of isolation; to watch, i.e. Be on guard; by implication, to preserve, obey, avoid.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deposit, anything committed to one's charge or trust. From paratithemi; a deposit, i.e. trust.

20.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
20.str2: From ek and the base of trope; to deflect, i.e. Turn away.
Permitted to be trodden, accessible. From the base of basis and belos; accessible, i.e. heathenish, wicked.
Empty disputing, worthless babble. From a presumed compound of kenos and phone; empty sounding, i.e. Fruitless discussion.
From a compound of anti and tithemi; opposition, i.e. A conflict.
Falsely named, under a false name. From pseudes and onoma; untruly named.
Knowledge, doctrine, wisdom. From ginosko; knowing, i.e. knowledge.

21.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular
Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
21.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

21.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
21.str2: From epi and the base of aggelos; to announce upon, i.e. to engage to do something, to assert something respecting oneself.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
21.str2: From a compound of a and stoichos; to miss the mark, i.e. deviate from truth.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
21.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
